text:
*[Bug 18896] readRDS silently returns NULL on malformed RDS*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18896>

--- Comment #9 from Karine Even-Mendoza (<mailto:karine.even_mendoza@kcl.ac.uk|karine.even_mendoza@kcl.ac.uk>) ---
We’re fuzzing machine learning libraries (in this case, KMEANS) and needed an R
driver to run them. While debugging a crash, initially suspected to be in the
driver rather than KMEANS, we encountered this issue. The issues stem from how
set.seed(NULL) behaves: it works without error, but breaks reproducibility of
the KMEANS test case. This could have been avoided if, as in previous versions,
a warning/exception had been raised. 

I assume that I am not the only one writing drivers for automated processes for
ML libraries in R, so I was thinking it would be useful to fix that.
Nonetheless, given the debugging I did, it seems just like a missing check.

elements.text: [Bug 18896] readRDS silently returns NULL on malformed RDS

) ---
We’re fuzzing machine learning libraries (in this case, KMEANS) and needed an R
driver to run them. While debugging a crash, initially suspected to be in the
driver rather than KMEANS, we encountered this issue. The issues stem from how
set.seed(NULL) behaves: it works without error, but breaks reproducibility of
the KMEANS test case. This could have been avoided if, as in previous versions,
a warning/exception had been raised. 

I assume that I am not the only one writing drivers for automated processes for
ML libraries in R, so I was thinking it would be useful to fix that.
Nonetheless, given the debugging I did, it seems just like a missing check.

*[Bug 18791] dngettext replacement macro should be careful about operators*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18791>

--- Comment #2 from Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) ---
Bump here, it seems like this trivial improvement should be easy to review &
patch in :)

We might consider `()`-wrapping `String` and `StringP` as well.
